title: Unroofing mammalian cells for AFM

source.description:
Mix the following at
powder in
On the day of intended use, also prepare 1g/10ml

cases.title: If AEBSF and DTT ar not used that day
cases.label: Store at

source.description: Dilute depending on method of storage

source.body: Glutaraldehyde is better for crosslinking and structure preservation, paraformaldehyde is faster and better for thick tissue

source.description:
Create buffers "HEPES-free Ringer;s", "Ringer's" and "Ca++ free Ringer's" by
  1. adding "check V final" from the attached table into a beaker
  2. Adjusting the pH with KOH TO 7.4 while mixing on a magnetic plate
  3. Adding DI water to the final volume of 100mL

source.body: If pH gets too high, adjust with HCl, but do not surpass the final volume

Make sure to add calcium at the end
Wear protective equipment when using strong bases

cases.title: If buffers are not needed that day
cases.label: These buffers can be stored in the fridge

source.description: Prepare KHMgE buffer. If not using that day, leave out the DTT and add before use

source.body: Use caution with AEBSF; check if other protease inhibitor is available. Avoid preparing stock as it is unstable in water

AEBSF should preserve protein structure better due to protease inhibition
DTT is a redox reagent to stabilize protein

source.description: Prepare cells on cover slips

source.title: Basic Cell Culture Maintenance: Splitting Cells

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"78atc","text":"Confirm that cells are at least 80% confluent by microscopy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqcfr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d35u2","text":"Aspirate\u00a0the media from\u00a0the flask using a sterile autoclaved glass pipette. Do not touch the cells with the pipette.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":76,"length":41,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8i3kp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2ivd2\",\"text\":\"To avoid touching cells, is best to tilt the flask and gently remove media from a corner.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}"}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvr7t","text":"Careful not to disturb cells adhered to the wall with the flow, add 5 mL PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6n3s8","text":"Add 3 mL trypsin and gently rock the flask to cover cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"18i86","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"92f4n\",\"text\":\"Trypsin is harmful to the cells. Pay special attention that cells are not in trypsin longer than one minute.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}"}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40fj4","text":"Remove cells from incubator and quickly, smack!\u00a0 until cells are no longer adhered to the wall.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":47,"style":"bold"},{"offset":0,"length":47,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ni97","text":"Add 7mL warm complete medium, rinsing multiple times by pipetting up and down, to neutralize the trypsin reaction. Pipette towards cell side of flask walls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"11dkj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"dj1jm\",\"text\":\"Trypsin may destroy your cells if you are not fast enough to neutralize it.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}"}]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"csjjs","text":"Transfer ALL contents\/cells to a 50 mL falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a7bb","text":"Spin down 3,000 rpm for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f6g6v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"13637","duration":"300","label":"Spin down cells at 3,000 rpm.","guid":"0917F3CEA30147DAA312CFDEEC61844A"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ldkt","text":"While spinning, clean surfaces with EtOH and label new flasks, noting the +1 passage number and dilution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gsqa","text":"Aspirate media from falcon tubes with cells; make sure to not disturb the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4h95n","text":"Add 10 mL media to pellet and pipette violently up and down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":38,"length":9,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f38jd","text":"Add 8 mL fresh media to new flask, then 2 mL of resuspended cells. (2:10 dilution)\nOr 9 mL fresh media, then 1 mL resuspended cells. (1:10 dilution)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":83,"length":2,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bof3","text":"Gently shuffle, ensure even dispersal, and return the fresh flask to incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6qq7","text":"Sterilize the biosafety cabinet with 10% bleach for 20 minutes. Spray down the biosafety cabinet with 70% ethanol and use UV light for 15 minutes as a secondary decontaminant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8aqhl","text":"Warm complete DMEM in 37\u00b0C water bath and thaw trypsin at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58h9e","text":"Gently swish PBS over cells to wash off the media by gently rocking it over the cells on\u00a0the flask wall.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eicnr","text":"Quickly, aspirate PBS out. Cells will detach if PBS is left on them for\u00a0too long.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bc0do","text":"Incubate flask at 37\u00b0 for 30 seconds to 1 minute until cells start lifting off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8o481","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"e0u5p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"14861","duration":"30","label":"Incubate cells with trypsin.","guid":"705058EBFA514D8588C2AB24B77A211A"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1of54\",\"text\":\"During incubation, quickly prepare and label a 50 mL falcon tube for the next steps.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}"}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcudm","text":"Count and plate cells with leftovers after splitting, then move on to transfection or other experiments tommorow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

materials.name: HyClone Classical Liquid Media Dulbeccos Modified Eagles Medium (DMEM)

vendor.name: HyClone Classical Liquid Media Dulbeccos Modified Eagles Medium (DMEM)

source.description: Basic protocol to split Human Embryonic Kidney 293 (HEK293) cells to maintain them throughout the week and move on to cell culture plating with leftover cells for future experiments.
Wash fixed cells once with (HEPES)-based Ringer's solution and then with Ca++-free Ringer's solution.

source.body: HEPES should improve appearance of cell health

source.description: Soak the cover slips for about 10 s in poly-lysine solution (0.5 mg ml−1poly-lysine dissolved in Ca++-free Ringer's solution), wash three times for a few seconds each in hypotonic Ringer's solution prepared by mixing one part of Ringer's solution with two parts of distilled water (DW).

source.body: This induced cell swelling, which enabled the cells to burst easily following ultrasonic stimulation.
Keep sonicator power below "micropore" max

source.description: Wash briefly in fresh KHMgE buffer
Wash fixed cells twice with KHMgE buffer and use for imaging and AFM
Immediately after immersing in hypotonic solution, expose cells to a small bubble jet by weak ultrasonic vibration in isotonic KHMgE buffer

source.specifications: The Model 3000 delivers up to 300 watts of ultrasonic disruption and includes an integrated Sound Abating Chamber to reduce cavitational sound emitted during processing. The clear Plexiglas door permits viewing of the sample while protecting the operator against accidental splashing. An access port for tubing is also provided for use with Cup Tips and the Continuous Flow Chamber. The Timer and Pulser function increase precision in sample processing.
source.name: Model 3000

source.description: Fix for 10 min with 0.5% glutaraldehyde and 1% paraformaldehyde in KHMgE buffer.

description: Unroofing mammalian adhesive cells for the purpose of AFM imaging
